PLINK.title: PLINK
PLINK.content:
PLINK is a popular open-source genetic data analysis tool primarily used in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and population genetics. Itâ€™s super efficient for handling large-scale genotype data, especially in .ped/.map or .bed/.bim/.fam formats.
ðŸ”¹ What it does:


Data filtering (e.g., MAF, HWE, missingness)


Association testing (case/control, quantitative traits)


LD pruning and clumping


IBD/IBS analysis


PCA for population structure


File format conversion (e.g., VCF â†’ PLINK)


ðŸ”¹ Common PLINK commands:
plink --bfile data --assoc         # Basic association test
plink --bfile data --make-bed      # Convert to binary PLINK format
plink --bfile data --pca           # Principal component analysis
ðŸ”¹ Why people love it:

Itâ€™s lightweight and fast
Easy to script in pipelines
Plays well with R, Python, and other tools like REGENIE, BOLT-LMM, and PRSice

If youâ€™re starting with GWAS or QC, PLINK is pretty much your go-to tool. Let me know if you want a quick setup or example run!
